profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:12:47 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Over 600 subject files containing Mann's research on the history of photography; and an extensive interview conducted by Mann with Imogen Cunningham.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REELS 1860-1872: 630 files cover photographers, photo exhibitions, societies, publications, and collections and contain biographical information, correspondence, published and unpublished transcripts by Mann, exhibition catalogs and announcements, price lists, photographs, organization records, clippings and printed material along with Mann's interviews of Wynn Bullock, Imogen Cunningham (partial), and Edward Ruscha. Photographs are by Linda Connor, Imogen Cunningham (includes one of dancer Martha Graham), Judy Dater (of Cunningham), Robert Heinecken, Anne Noggle, Leland Rice, Charles Swedlund, Arthur Tress, Jerry Uelsmann, Todd Walker, Jack Welpott, and Brett Weston.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 5051 (fr. 390-600): Interview (232 p. transcript from 3 sound reels, 3 in.) of Imogen Cunningham conducted by Mann, 1960-1973, in preparation for her book, Imogen Cunningham: Photographs. Cunningham speaks of the sale and exhibition of her prints; being a "darkroom slave"; portrait photography; photographs as documents; the "soft-focus era"; teaching; and the f/64 Group. Cunningham comments on 104 of her photographs, including her portraits of Edward Weston and Margrethe Mather, Martha Graham, Cary Grant, Alfred Stieglitz, Upton Sinclair, Adedee Ozenfant, Frieda Kahlo Rivera, Getrude Stein, Shen Yao, Lyonel Feininger, Morris Graves, Anna Freud, and Minor White. She recalls Diane Arbus, Arthur Fellig, Paul Strand, and others.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 1860-1872 & 5051 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Photographer, photography historian and critic; Davis, Calif.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Cunningham interview was donated by Mann in 1975; the remainder by Mann's husband, Thomas K. Vasey, 1978.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: List of subject files is available at Archives of American Art offices.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Files of Margery Mann, 1919-1977, are also located at the National Gallery of Australia.
